Hibah Penelitian Fundamental Komputasi Kuantum
Quantum Computing Algorithms for Optimization Problems
Penelitian Dasar Unggulan Perguruan Tinggi (PDUPT)
Prof. Dr. Ir. Ahmad Faizal, M.Sc.
Dr. Siti Nurjanah, S.Kom., M.Kom. Dr. Budi Santoso, S.Si., M.Sc. Ratna Sari, S.Kom., M.Kom., Ph.D.
active
Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi
APBN - Direktorat Jenderal Pendidikan Tinggi
Quantum Computing, Algorithm Design, Computational Physics
quantum computing, quantum algorithms, optimization, computational complexity, quantum simulation

Tujuan Penelitian:
  1. Mengembangkan algoritma kuantum baru untuk menyelesaikan masalah optimasi kombinatorial
  2. Mengimplementasikan algoritma pada quantum simulator dan real quantum hardware
  3. Melakukan benchmarking performa algoritma kuantum vs klasik
  4. Publikasi minimal 5 paper di jurnal internasional Q1/Q2
  5. Melatih 3 doktor dan 6 magister di bidang quantum computing

Metode Penelitian:

  • Studi teoretis quantum algorithms (QAOA, VQE, Quantum Annealing)
  • Development dan testing pada IBM Quantum Experience dan AWS Braket
  • Quantum circuit optimization dan error mitigation techniques
  • Comparative analysis dengan classical optimization algorithms
  • Application pada real-world problems (logistics, finance, drug discovery)

• 3-5 novel quantum algorithms untuk optimization problems
  • Open-source quantum algorithm library
  • 5+ publikasi di jurnal Q1/Q2 (Physical Review, Nature Communications, dll)
  • 3 lulusan Ph.D. dan 6 lulusan Master
  • Kerjasama dengan IBM Quantum Network
True
MIT - Center for Quantum Engineering University of Oxford - Quantum Computing Research Group IBM Quantum Network
Muhammad Rizki - Quantum Algorithms for Logistics Optimization Siti Rahmawati - Variational Quantum Eigensolver Applications Andi Kurniawan - Quantum Machine Learning

Budi Hartono - Thesis: QAOA for Graph Coloring Maya Lestari - Thesis: Quantum Annealing for Scheduling Dian Purnama - Thesis: Error Mitigation in NISQ Devices Rizky Fauzi - Thesis: Quantum Circuit Optimization Fitri Handayani - Thesis: Hybrid Quantum-Classical Algorithms Eko Prasetyo - Thesis: Quantum Simulation of Molecular Systems

• "Novel Quantum Algorithm for Vehicle Routing Problem" - Physical Review A, 2024 (Published)
  • "Variational Quantum Eigensolver for Drug Discovery Applications" - Nature Communications, Under Review
  • "Error Mitigation Techniques in NISQ Era Quantum Computing" - Quantum Science and Technology, 2024 (Published)
  • "Benchmarking Quantum vs Classical Optimization Algorithms" - IEEE Quantum Engineering, In Preparation

- International Conference on Quantum Computing (ICQC) 2023, Singapore - Quantum Information Processing (QIP) 2024, Taiwan - IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering 2024, USA

MilestoneStatusCompletion
Literature Review & Theoretical Framework✓Mar 2023
Algorithm Development Phase 1✓Sep 2023
Implementation on Quantum Simulator✓Mar 2024
Testing on Real Quantum Hardware⋯In Progress
Benchmarking & Optimization○Planned 2025
Final Publications & Report○Planned 2025

• Running experiments pada IBM Quantum 127-qubit processor
  • Developing error mitigation framework untuk NISQ devices
  • Collaborating dengan industry partner untuk real-world applications
  • Preparing 2 manuscripts untuk submission ke Nature Quantum Information

Penelitian ini sangat penting karena quantum computing diprediksi akan merevolusi banyak industri dalam 10-20 tahun ke depan. Indonesia perlu mempersiapkan SDM dan research capability di bidang ini agar tidak tertinggal. Penelitian fundamental ini akan menjadi foundation untuk pengembangan quantum technology di Indonesia.

Hibah Kolaborasi Riset Indonesia-Jepang: Robotika untuk Disaster Response
Indonesia-Japan Joint Research: Robotic Systems for Disaster Management
Indonesia-Japan Joint Research Program
Dr. Ir. Hendra Gunawan, M.Eng.
Dr. Maya Puspita, S.T., M.T. Prof. Takeshi Yamamoto (Tokyo Institute of Technology) Dr. Rudi Hermawan, S.T., M.T. Dr. Siti Aminah, S.T., M.Eng.
active
Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST) & Kemenristek BRIN
International Joint Research Fund
Robotics, Disaster Management, AI, Autonomous Systems
disaster robotics, search and rescue, autonomous systems, teleoperation, AI for disaster response, unmanned ground vehicles

Research Objectives:
  1. Develop autonomous robotic systems untuk search and rescue operations di area bencana
  2. Create AI-powered victim detection system menggunakan computer vision dan thermal imaging
  3. Design robust communication system untuk remote operation di challenging environments
  4. Conduct field testing di disaster simulation facilities Indonesia dan Jepang
  5. Build capacity dan knowledge transfer antara peneliti Indonesia dan Jepang

Research Methodology:

  • Robot Platform Development: Design all-terrain mobile robot dengan manipulator arm
  • AI System: Deep learning untuk victim detection, path planning, dan obstacle avoidance
  • Communication: Multi-modal communication (RF, satellite, mesh network)
  • Testing: Simulation dan field testing di disaster training center
  • Integration: Integration dengan existing disaster management systems (BNPB)

• 3 prototype disaster response robots (ground, aerial, amphibious)
  • AI system dengan detection accuracy >90% dalam various disaster scenarios
  • 10+ joint publications di international journals dan conferences
  • Patent applications untuk novel robotic mechanisms dan algorithms
  • Training program untuk BNPB dan disaster response teams
  • 20 researchers exchange visits between Indonesia and Japan
Tokyo Institute of Technology, Japan Waseda University, Japan Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Bencana (BNPB) BMKG - Indonesian Meteorology Agency Institut Teknologi Bandung
True
Tokyo Institute of Technology - Robotics Lab Waseda University - Disaster Robotics Research Center NEDO (New Energy and Industrial Technology Development Organization), Japan
Andi Kurniawan - Research: AI for Victim Detection in Rubble Dewi Purnama - Research: Teleoperation in High-Latency Networks

Budi Hartono - Thesis: Path Planning for All-Terrain Robots Sari Lestari - Thesis: Thermal Imaging for Victim Detection Rizky Fauzi - Thesis: Swarm Robotics for Search and Rescue Maya Kusuma - Thesis: Human-Robot Interaction in Disaster Scenarios

• "Autonomous Navigation for Disaster Response Robots in GPS-Denied Environments" - IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters, 2024
  • "Deep Learning for Victim Detection Using Multimodal Sensor Fusion" - Journal of Field Robotics, Under Review
  • "Design and Testing of All-Terrain Mobile Robot for Search and Rescue" - IROS 2024 Conference

Prototype Robots yang telah dikembangkan:

  • ResQ-Ground v2: All-terrain tracked robot dengan manipulator arm, thermal camera, dan gas sensors
  • ResQ-Air v1: Quadcopter drone untuk aerial survey dan victim localization
  • ResQ-Water v1: Amphibious robot untuk flood rescue operations

• Best Paper Award - IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2024
  • Innovation Award - RoboCup Rescue Robot League 2024

Indonesia adalah negara dengan tingkat bencana alam yang tinggi (gempa, tsunami, banjir, longsor). Robotic systems ini dapat membantu tim SAR dalam operasi penyelamatan, terutama di area berbahaya yang sulit diakses manusia. Teknologi ini dapat menyelamatkan lebih banyak nyawa dan mempercepat proses evakuasi korban. Selain itu, proyek ini meningkatkan capability disaster response di Indonesia.

Setelah proyek selesai, robots akan diserahkan ke BNPB untuk operasional. Tim peneliti akan terus provide technical support dan training. Kerjasama dengan Japan akan dilanjutkan untuk continuous improvement dan development. Ada juga rencana untuk commercialization dengan kerjasama industry partners.

• Field testing ResQ-Ground v2 di disaster training center Sentul
  • Researcher exchange: 3 researchers ke Tokyo Institute of Technology (3 bulan)
  • Joint workshop dengan BNPB dan disaster response teams
  • Development AI model untuk various disaster scenarios

Pendanaan Riset Kolaborasi Industri: AI untuk Quality Control Manufacturing
Industry Partnership: Computer Vision for Automated Quality Inspection
Industry-University Research Collaboration
Dr. Ratna Kusuma, S.T., M.T.
Dr. Agus Wijaya, S.Kom., M.Kom. Ir. Bambang Sutrisno, M.T. Maya Sari, S.Kom., M.Kom.
active
PT. Astra Manufacturing Indonesia
Industry Research Fund
Computer Vision, Quality Control, Manufacturing, AI
computer vision, defect detection, quality control, deep learning, automated inspection, Industry 4.0

Project Objectives:
  1. Develop AI-powered visual inspection system untuk deteksi defect pada automotive parts
  2. Achieve detection accuracy >99% dengan false positive rate <1%
  3. Reduce inspection time dari 30 detik menjadi <2 detik per part
  4. Implement sistem di 5 production lines dengan 20+ inspection stations
  5. Train model untuk 15+ different product types dan 50+ defect categories

Development Approach:

  • Data Collection: Acquire 100,000+ images dari production line (normal dan defective parts)
  • Annotation: Expert labeling untuk berbagai jenis defect (scratch, dent, crack, discoloration)
  • Model Development: Transfer learning dari pretrained models (EfficientNet, ResNet, YOLO)
  • Optimization: Model quantization dan optimization untuk real-time inference
  • Integration: Integration dengan existing MES (Manufacturing Execution System)

• AI inspection system deployed di 5 production lines
  • Detection accuracy 99.5% dengan throughput 1800 parts/hour
  • Cost saving Rp 2.5 miliar/tahun dari reduced labor dan rework
  • Quality improvement dengan defect escape rate <0.1%
  • 2 patents untuk novel inspection methods
  • Technology transfer dan commercialization untuk industries lain
PT. Astra Manufacturing Indonesia - Automotive Components PT. Intel Technology Indonesia - Edge Computing Hardware NVIDIA Indonesia - GPU and AI Platform
Andi Saputra - Thesis: Deep Learning for Surface Defect Detection Fitri Handayani - Thesis: Few-Shot Learning for Rare Defect Types Rizky Fauzi - Thesis: Edge AI Optimization for Real-time Inspection
Budi Hartono (TA: Data Augmentation Techniques) Siti Rahmawati (TA: Explainable AI for Quality Inspection) Dian Purnama (TA: Dashboard Development)

• "Deep Learning for Automated Visual Inspection in Automotive Manufacturing" - Journal of Manufacturing Systems, 2024
  • "Few-Shot Learning Approach for Rare Defect Detection" - IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics, Under Review

• Patent Filed: "Sistem Inspeksi Visual Otomatis Berbasis AI dengan Multi-Angle Camera Setup" - P00202400567
  • Patent Planned: "Adaptive Learning System for Quality Inspection AI"

• ✓ Data collection 150,000 images (exceeding target)
  • ✓ Model development achieving 99.6% accuracy on test set
  • ✓ Pilot implementation di 2 production lines (successful)
  • ⋯ Scale-up to 5 production lines (in progress)
  • ○ Full system integration dengan MES (Q4 2024)

Quantifiable Benefits:

  • Productivity increase: 40% faster inspection time
  • Labor cost saving: Rp 1.2 miliar/tahun (reduction dari 20 inspectors ke 5 operators)
  • Quality cost saving: Rp 1.3 miliar/tahun dari reduced warranty claims dan rework
  • Overall ROI: 18 months payback period
  • Potential market size: 200+ automotive suppliers in Indonesia

• Fine-tuning model untuk 5 new product types
  • Installing camera systems di 3 additional lines
  • Training operators dan maintenance staff
  • Developing mobile app untuk remote monitoring

Challenges & Solutions:

  • Challenge: Limited data untuk rare defect types ⟹ Solution: Implemented few-shot learning dan synthetic data generation
  • Challenge: Variation in lighting conditions ⟹ Solution: Custom LED lighting setup dan image preprocessing
  • Challenge:Real-time performance requirement ⟹ Solution: Model optimization dan edge computing with NVIDIA Jetson

Hibah Inkubasi Startup Teknologi: EduTech Platform untuk Pendidikan Vokasi
Startup Incubation Grant: AI-Powered Vocational Education Platform
STARTUP-2024-012
Program Inkubasi Startup Teknologi Kemendikbudristek
Dr. Maya Puspita Sari, S.Kom., M.Kom.
Rudi Hermawan, S.Kom., M.M. Fitri Rahmawati, S.Pd., M.Pd. Andi Kurniawan, S.Kom., M.T.
active
Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi
Program Merdeka Belajar - Dana Inkubasi Startup
Educational Technology, AI, E-Learning, Vocational Training
edutech, vocational education, AI tutoring, adaptive learning, skills training, online learning platform

Project Goals:
  1. Develop AI-powered adaptive learning platform untuk pendidikan vokasi
  2. Create 100+ interactive courses untuk 10 vocational skills (welding, electrical, automotive, etc.)
  3. Acquire 10,000 active users dalam 12 bulan
  4. Partnership dengan 20 SMK dan 10 industri untuk job placement
  5. Achieve sustainable business model dengan monthly revenue Rp 50 juta+

Development & Business Strategy:

  • Platform Development: Web dan mobile app dengan video pembelajaran, simulasi virtual, dan AI tutoring
  • Content Creation: Kolaborasi dengan expert teachers dan industry practitioners
  • AI Features: Personalized learning path, automated assessment, dan chatbot mentor
  • Go-to-Market: Freemium model dengan B2C dan B2B (SMK, training centers)
  • Partnership: Job placement program dengan industry partners

• Platform dengan 100+ courses dan 500+ video pembelajaran
  • 10,000+ registered users, 3,000+ active learners
  • Partnership dengan 20 SMK dan 10 companies
  • 500+ students successfully placed in jobs
  • Monthly revenue Rp 50-75 juta (sustainable business)
  • Follow-on investment dari VC (target: Series A Rp 5 miliar)
SMKN 1 Jakarta - Pilot School SMKN 2 Bandung - Content Development Partner SMKN 5 Surabaya - Testing & Feedback Kadin Indonesia - Industry Liaison Asosiasi SMK Indonesia

PT. Astra International - Job Placement Partner PT. Schneider Electric - Electrical Skills Training Content PT. Toyota Astra Motor - Automotive Training Curriculum PT. Unilever Indonesia - Manufacturing Skills Program
Dian Purnama - Thesis: AI Recommendation System untuk Learning Path
Budi Santoso (TA: Chatbot Development) Siti Rahmawati (TA: Gamification Design) Rizky Fauzi (TA: Video Analytics)

Current Platform Features:

  • Web platform dan Android/iOS mobile apps
  • 50 courses available (automotive, electrical, welding, HVAC, plumbing)
  • 300+ video tutorials dengan interactive quizzes
  • AI chatbot mentor untuk Q&A 24/7
  • Virtual simulation untuk safety training
  • Certificate of completion recognized oleh industry partners

• 3,500 registered users dalam 6 bulan (35% of target)
  • 1,200 active learners dengan avg completion rate 65%
  • 150 students successfully placed in jobs
  • Winner of Startup Competition "Inovasi Pendidikan 2024"
  • Featured in 5 national media (Kompas, Detik, CNN Indonesia)

Platform ini memberikan akses pendidikan vokasi berkualitas kepada masyarakat luas, terutama di daerah yang kekurangan instruktur berkualitas. Dengan pembelajaran online yang fleksibel, siswa dapat belajar skills marketable dengan biaya terjangkau. Program job placement membantu mengurangi pengangguran lulusan SMK yang saat ini mencapai 12%.

Business Metrics:

  • Current MRR (Monthly Recurring Revenue): Rp 18 juta
  • Average Revenue Per User: Rp 15,000/month
  • Conversion rate free to paid: 8%
  • Customer Acquisition Cost: Rp 45,000
  • Lifetime Value: Rp 180,000
  • Projected breakeven: Q2 2025

Revenue model: Freemium (basic courses free, premium courses Rp 50k-150k), B2B licensing untuk SMK (Rp 5 juta/tahun per school), dan commission dari job placement (15% dari first month salary). Target raising Series A funding Rp 5 miliar di Q4 2025 untuk scale-up operations dan expand to 50 vocational skills.

• Developing 30 new courses (target: 50 → 80 courses by end of 2024)
  • Pilot program di 5 SMK dengan 500 students
  • Marketing campaign targeting SMK students dan job seekers
  • Preparing pitch deck untuk investor roadshow

• Launch mobile app versi 2.0 dengan offline capability
  • Expand partnership ke 15 additional SMKs
  • Develop VR/AR simulation untuk advanced training
  • International expansion: pilot in Malaysia dan Philippines

Hibah Pengabdian: Pemberdayaan UMKM melalui Digitalisasi dan E-Commerce
Community Service: Digital Transformation for Small Businesses
Program Kemitraan Masyarakat (PKM)
Dr. Siti Aminah, S.E., M.M.
Rudi Setiawan, S.Kom., M.Kom. Dr. Fitri Handayani, S.E., M.Si. Bambang Prasetyo, S.Kom., M.T.
active
Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi
Dana Pengabdian Kepada Masyarakat
Community Development, Digital Economy, E-Commerce, UMKM Empowerment
UMKM, digital transformation, e-commerce, digital marketing, community empowerment, small business

Program Objectives:
  1. Melatih 100 pelaku UMKM dalam digital marketing dan e-commerce
  2. Membantu 50 UMKM membuat toko online di marketplace (Tokopedia, Shopee, dll)
  3. Meningkatkan omzet UMKM minimal 30% dalam 6 bulan
  4. Develop website e-commerce komunal untuk produk lokal
  5. Create sustainable digital ecosystem untuk UMKM binaan

Program Implementation:

  • Training Program: 8 sesi workshop (digital literacy, product photography, copywriting, ads management)
  • Hands-on Assistance: One-on-one mentoring untuk setup online store
  • Platform Development: Website e-commerce komunal dengan payment gateway
  • Marketing Support: Social media campaign dan influencer collaboration
  • Monitoring & Evaluation: Monthly follow-up dan performance tracking

• 100 UMKM trained dengan certification
  • 50 online stores successfully launched
  • Average omzet increase 30-50%
  • Community e-commerce website dengan 50+ products
  • Sustainable UMKM community yang saling support
  • Model replikasi untuk komunitas UMKM lain
Dinas Koperasi dan UMKM Kota Bandung Asosiasi UMKM Jawa Barat Universitas Padjadjaran - Fakultas Ekonomi Bank BRI - Program KUR Tokopedia - Seller Education Program
Andi Saputra (KKN: Product Photography Training) Maya Lestari (KKN: Social Media Content Creation) Dian Purnama (KKN: Website Development) Rizky Fauzi (KKN: Video Tutorial Production)

• 110 UMKM trained (110% of target)
  • 52 online stores launched successfully
  • Average omzet increase: 45% dalam 6 bulan
  • Community website: 1,500+ monthly visitors, Rp 25 juta monthly GMV
  • 3 UMKM binaan menjadi best seller di kategorinya
  • Featured di Kompas TV "Bisnis Anak Muda"

Community Impact:

  • 100+ families meningkat income dengan additional Rp 2-5 juta/bulan
  • 30 UMKM yang sebelumnya "offline only" kini punya customer nationwide
  • Terbentuk komunitas digital UMKM yang saling support dan share knowledge
  • 20 employment created (UMKM hire additional workers karena increased demand)
  • Preserved traditional crafts dan products lokal melalui digital market access

Setelah program selesai, komunitas UMKM akan continue dengan koordinator lokal yang sudah ditraining. Website akan dikelola oleh koperasi UMKM dengan revenue sharing model. Partnership dengan marketplace dan bank akan dilanjutkan untuk continuous support. Ada juga rencana untuk scale ke kabupaten lain di Jawa Barat.

• Advanced training: Instagram Ads dan TikTok Shop (50 participants)
  • Product packaging improvement workshop
  • Facilitating partnership dengan distributor untuk bulk orders
  • Documentation untuk best practices guidebook

Progress Reports:

  • Laporan Kemajuan 1 (Maret 2024): Setup awal, recruitment participants - ✓ Approved
  • Laporan Kemajuan 2 (Juni 2024): Training completion, store setup - ✓ Approved
  • Laporan Kemajuan 3 (September 2024): Performance evaluation, website launch - ✓ Approved
  • Laporan Akhir (Target: Desember 2024): Final evaluation dan sustainability plan
